en: In Jehovah do I take refuge: How say ye to my soul, Flee as a bird to your mountain;
hmr: LALPAA chun ka ringna kân nghat hlak a, Iengtizieha ka hringna kuoma hin, “In tlânga chun vate angin vuong hmang ro,” in ti?

en: For, lo, the wicked bend the bow, They make ready their arrow upon the string, That they may shoot in darkness at the upright in heart;
hmr: En ta u, lungril indiktak put inthim hnuoia an kâp theina dingin, Mi rilohai chun thalngul an kuoi a, An thal chu a hruiah an inbûk diem saw!

en: If the foundations be destroyed, What can the righteous do?
hmr: Lungphûmhai chu suksieta a um chun, Mi felin ieng am sukse thei a ta?

en: Jehovah is in his holy temple; Jehovah, his throne is in heaven; His eyes behold, his eyelids try, the children of men.
hmr: LALPA chu a biekin inthiengah a um a, LALPA chu a ṭhungpha chu vânah a um; Mihriem nauhai hi a mitin a en a, a mitvun chun a fie hlak.

en: Jehovah trieth the righteous; But the wicked and him that loveth violence his soul hateth.
hmr: LALPA chun mi fel le mi rilo chu a fie hlak a. Nunrâwngna ngaina mi chu a hringna chun a theida hlak.

en: Upon the wicked he will rain snares; Fire and brimstone and burning wind shall be the portion of their cup.
hmr: Mi rilohai chunga chun chânghai insûrtir a ta, Mei le kât le thil lumtak chu an no chan ding nîng a tih.

en: For Jehovah is righteous; he loveth righteousness: The upright shall behold his face.
hmr: LALPA chu a fel sih a, felna hi a ngaina hlak, Mi indiktakhai chun a hmêl la hmûng an tih.
